text: A ketone is an organic compound that has a carbon atom with a double bond to an oxygen atom (this is called carbonyl functional group). This carbon atom must also have single bonds to two other carbon atoms. A ketone can be produced by oxidating a secondary alcohol. Spectroscopy: A ketone will show a strong peak between 1690 and 1715cm-1 using infrared spectroscopy.Padias, Anne. Making the Connections: A How-to guide for Organic Chemistry Lab Techniques. 2nd. Plymouth: Hayden-McNeil, 2011. pp 73. Print. ==References== *Ketogenic diet ==References== Category:Functional groups
title: Ketone
